description: Numbers n such that 16^n - 15^n is prime.
comments: Terms greater than 1000 may correspond to (unproven) strong pseudoprimes.No other terms less than 100000. - _Robert Price_, Apr 15 2012
author: _Mike Oakes_, May 18 2001, May 19 2001
extensions: One more term (12281) found by _Mike Oakes_ in August 2003 corresponding to a probable prime with 14788 digits.
One more term (24889) found by _Jean-Louis Charton_ in December 2010 corresponding to a probable prime with 29970 digits.
